description.text: The seven fundamental principles of Hermetic philosophy as applied to tarot interpretation

quote.text: The principles of truth are seven; he who knows these, understandingly, possesses the magic key before whose touch all the doors of the temple fly open.

principle.text: The All is Mind; the Universe is Mental

tarot_application.text: All tarot readings reflect the mental state and consciousness of the querent

practical_meaning.text: Thoughts create reality and influence outcomes

quote.text: Mind is the master power that moulds and makes, and man is mind, and evermore he takes the tool of thought, and, shaping what he wills, brings forth a thousand joys, a thousand ills.

principle.text: As above, so below; as below, so above

tarot_application.text: Patterns in the cards reflect patterns in life and cosmos

practical_meaning.text: Microcosm reflects macrocosm in all divination

quote.text: That which is below is like that which is above, and that which is above is like that which is below, to accomplish the miracles of the one thing.

principle.text: Nothing rests; everything moves; everything vibrates

tarot_application.text: Each card carries specific vibrational frequencies

practical_meaning.text: Energy states can be shifted through conscious intention

quote.text: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.

principle.text: Everything is dual; everything has poles; opposites are identical in nature

tarot_application.text: All cards contain both positive and negative potentials

practical_meaning.text: Understanding polarity allows for conscious choice

quote.text: Opposites are identical in nature, but different in degree; extremes meet; all truths are but half-truths.

principle.text: Everything flows, out and in; the pendulum-swing manifests in everything

tarot_application.text: Card meanings change with life cycles and timing

practical_meaning.text: Life moves in cycles of expansion and contraction

quote.text: To everything there is a season, and a time to every purpose under heaven.

principle.text: Every cause has its effect; every effect has its cause

tarot_application.text: Card combinations show karmic patterns and consequences

practical_meaning.text: Present situations result from past choices

quote.text: The law of karma is the law of cause and effect in the moral world.

principle.text: Everything has its masculine and feminine principles

tarot_application.text: All cards express both active and receptive energies

practical_meaning.text: Balance of masculine and feminine creates harmony

quote.text: The masculine and feminine principles exist in all planes of creation.

description.text: The twelve classical alchemical operations and their correspondence to tarot transformation

quote.text: Alchemy is the art of transmuting base metals into gold, but more importantly, it is the art of transmuting the base human soul into spiritual gold.

psychological_process.text: Burning away ego attachments and false beliefs

spiritual_meaning.text: Destruction of illusions to reveal truth

quote.text: The first operation of the Great Work is the calcination of the base metal, representing the burning away of all that is false in human nature.

source.text: The Secret Teachings of All Ages

spiritual_meaning.text: Liquefying the solid ego to allow transformation

practical_application.text: Becoming more flexible and open to change

quote.text: Solution dissolves the fixed into the flowing, allowing the rigid boundaries of the ego to become permeable to divine influence.

spiritual_meaning.text: Separating the pure from the impure

quote.text: Separation is the operation by which we learn to distinguish between what belongs to our true nature and what is merely superficial conditioning.
Conjunction is the mystical marriage where opposites are united in perfect harmony, creating something greater than the sum of its parts.

source.text: Alchemy: An Introduction to the Symbolism and the Psychology

psychological_process.text: Allowing old self to die completely

practical_application.text: Accepting loss and grief as transformation

quote.text: Without putrefaction, nothing can be regenerated. The old must completely die before the new can be born.

source.text: The Twelve Keys of Basil Valentine

quote.text: Congelation fixes the volatile spirit into stable form, making permanent what was once fleeting inspiration.
Cibation is the gentle nourishment of the philosophical child, providing it with the spiritual food necessary for its growth.

psychological_process.text: Elevating base instincts to higher expression

spiritual_meaning.text: Transformation of lower nature into higher

practical_application.text: Channeling raw energy into creative expression

quote.text: Sublimation raises the earthly to the celestial, transforming base desires into divine inspiration.

bodily_correspondence.text: Transmutation of sexual energy into creativity

practical_application.text: Trusting the natural process of growth

quote.text: Fermentation is the resurrection phase where the philosopher's stone begins to manifest its miraculous properties.
Exaltation lifts the prepared soul to the heights of divine consciousness where it beholds the face of the eternal.
Multiplication demonstrates the infinite creative power of the perfected consciousness to generate limitless spiritual wealth.

practical_application.text: Becoming a force for positive change

quote.text: Projection is the final operation where the adept becomes a philosopher's stone, capable of transmuting all they touch.

description.text: The first matter from which all things are created

quote.text: The prima materia is the chaos mentioned by the ancients, containing in potential all forms and all possibilities.

universal_solvent.text: Dissolves all forms back to pure potential

dragon.text: The powerful force that must be tamed

green_lion.text: The raw life force before refinement

meaning.text: The unformed consciousness at the beginning of the journey

aspect.text: The naked truth of essential nature

meaning.text: Pure essence stripped of all artifice

psychological_meaning.text: The original nature before ego conditioning

spiritual_significance.text: The divine spark within all beings

practical_application.text: Returning to authentic self through spiritual practice

description.text: The ultimate goal of alchemy - the perfected consciousness

quote.text: The philosopher's stone is not a stone at all, but the perfect soul that has achieved union with the divine.

healing.text: Cures all diseases and extends life

quote.text: In the blackness of nigredo, all illusions die and the soul confronts its shadow.
The white queen emerges from the darkness, pure and receptive to divine light.
The yellow phase brings the dawn of spiritual understanding and inner illumination.
The red king represents the perfected consciousness that has achieved the Great Work.

tarot_completion.text: The World card represents the achieved philosopher's stone

spiritual_significance.text: Christ consciousness or Buddha nature realized

practical_application.text: Living as an embodiment of divine wisdom and love

description.text: Sacred symbols used in hermetic and alchemical practice

quote.text: Symbols are the language of the soul, speaking directly to the unconscious mind through archetypal imagery.

description.text: Classical hermetic literature and their tarot applications

tarot_application.text: The principle underlying all divinatory correspondence

quote.text: That which is below is like that which is above, and that which is above is like that which is below, to accomplish the miracles of the one thing.

practical_meaning.text: All tarot readings reflect cosmic patterns

tarot_application.text: The mental nature of all tarot interpretation

quote.text: Mind is the pilot of the soul, and mind, being the image of God, governs all things.

practical_meaning.text: Consciousness shapes the meaning of cards

quote.text: The lips of wisdom are closed, except to the ears of understanding.

practical_meaning.text: Tarot wisdom reveals itself according to the reader's level of understanding

description.text: The sacred union of opposites in hermetic philosophy

quote.text: The alchemical marriage is the union of the solar and lunar consciousness, creating the philosophical child of perfect wisdom.

meaning.text: Conscious and unconscious begin to recognize each other
Formal dedication to inner integration work

process.text: Active joining of masculine and feminine principles

description.text: The three principles of Paracelsian alchemy

quote.text: All things consist of three principles: Sulphur, Mercury, and Salt. These are the trinity that manifests in all creation.

meaning.text: The essential nature and driving force
The life force that animates and connects
The physical vessel and material expression
